DataElement.preferredName: Hepatic Infection Personal Medical History Ind-3
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no/unknown whether there is a personal medical history of hepatic infection.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the personal medical history of hepatic infection.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Refers to the liver.:general term for invasion and growth of microorganisms in bodily tissues.

Concepts.definition: Pertaining to, affecting, or associated with the liver.
general term for invasion and growth of microorganisms in bodily tissues.

Property.preferredDefinition: A record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual.  In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies. (NCI)

Concepts.definition: A record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual. In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/unknown.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/unknown.

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, or unknown.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.2.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Retired DBW 4-27-2016 per Tina Taylor approved by Dianne Reeves

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. 3/35/2016 jk removed "indeterminate" value that was added in error. 7/7/2021wz: added ALT VM name for HOPE-CARE project.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does patient have a history o
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a history of hepatitis B or hepatitis C infection

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have active hepatitis B or hepatitis C with abnormal liver function tests?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have active or known HIV, Hepatitis B or Hepatitis C?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Was evidence of active HBV infection detected

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient known to be seropositive for active hepatitis even if liver function studies are in the eligible range?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Positive hepatitis B antigen (HBsAg) or hepatitis C serology (HCV) tests

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG_CRF_Text_1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have known viral hepatitis

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Evidence of active HBV infection detected

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have active/known HIV, Hepatitis B or C?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have serostatus reflecting active hepatitis B or C infection?  Patients who are hepatitis B or C core antibody positive but antigen negative will need a negative polymerase chain reaction (PCR) prior to enrollment.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Positive hepatitis C serology or active hepatitis B infection, because of the risk of hepatic inflammation and the possible confounding of the assessment of drug toxicity.

ReferenceDocuments.name: DCP Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient HCV positive?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG_CRF_TEXT_2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a prior history of viral hepatitis B or C as demonstrated by positive serology

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 10
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has known active Hepatitis B (e.g., HBsAg reactive) or Hepatitis C (e.g., HCV RNA [qualitative] is detected)

ReferenceDocuments.name: PBTC_Text1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have an active Hepatitis C (HCV-RNA detected) infection?

ReferenceDocuments.name: PBTC_Text2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have an active Hepatitis C (HCV-RNA or anti-HCV antibody detected) infection?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 11
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have hepatitis B (HBV) or hepatitis C (HCV)

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF text1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a known history of HIV, Hepatitis B or Hepatitis C infection?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COF CRF Text 12
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have Hepatitis B and C serologies consistent with past or current infections?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 13
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a negative hepatitis B surface antigen [HBsAg] test and a positive anti-HBc [antibody to hepatitis B core antigen] antibody test

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 12
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did the patient have a past or resolved hepatitis B infection (defined as having a negative hepatitis B surface antigen [HBsAg] test and a positive anti-HBc [antibody to hepatitis B core antigen] antibody test

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF_Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient known to have positive Hepatitis B Surface Antigen (HepBsAg) (indicative of chronic Hepatitis B), positive Hepatitis total core antibody with negative HBsAG (suggestive of occult hepatitis B), or detectable Hepatitis C virus RNA by a polymerase-chain reaction (PCR) assay (indicative of active Hepatitis C  screening is generally done by Hepatitis C Antibody (HepCAb), followed by Hepatitis C virus RNA by PCR if HepCAb is positive)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 9
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have/had hepatitis B infection

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG_CRF_TEXT_14
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have known active hepatitis

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 15
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient had past or resolved hepatitis B infection?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Baseline Disease Description Form
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient tested positive for hepatitis B virus or hepatitis C virus indicating acute or chronic infection?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG_CRF_TEXT_16
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient known to have hepatitis B surface antigen seropositivity or known or suspected active hepatitis C infection

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 16
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have treated hepatitis viral infection (Hepatitis B and C)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 17
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have known active Hepatitis B or Hepatitis C infection on antiviral treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF_Text 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have an active hepatitis B (chronic or acute) or hepatitis C infection?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 18
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a past or resolved Hepatitis B infection?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF Text4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have known positive test for hepatitis B virus surface antigen (HBV sAg) or hepatitis C virus ribonucleic acid (HCV RNA) indicating acute or chronic infection?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text_1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have evidence of chronic hepatitis B virus (HBV) infection?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 19
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have known acute or chronic active Hepatitis B virus (HBV), Hepatitis C virus (HCV) or human immunodeficiency virus (HIV)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 17
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have Hepatitis B  serologies consistent with past or current infections?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 21
ReferenceDocuments.description: Known acute or chronic Hepatitis B or C that meets the requirements per the protocol?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 24
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have known acute or chronic hepatitis B or C infection?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 20
ReferenceDocuments.description: Known acute or chronic Hepatitis B or C that does not meet the requirements per the protocol?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 23
ReferenceDocuments.description: If the patient has known Hepatitis B or C do they meet the Hep B/C requirements in the protocol?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text25
ReferenceDocuments.description: Active viral infection with HIV, hepatitis B or hepatitis C?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have Hepatitis B or C infection as defined in the protocol?

DataElement.changeDescription: Replaced VD Chronic Disease Ind-3 (2018845v1) with VD Yes No Unknown Indicator (3506034v1) - dbw
